meanings.definition: Proposes (someone) as a candidate for re-election.
meanings.sent1: The mayor renominates himself for another term in office.
meanings.sent2: The committee renominates the current president for the upcoming election.
meanings.sent3: After his cat renominates him for the position of chief cuddler, he happily accepts.
meanings.sent4: The sun renominates itself every morning, rising to light up the world once again.
meanings.sent5: The teacher renominates the student as the class representative due to her excellent leadership skills.

meanings.sent1: She renominates her best friend for the talent show after the initial nominee dropped out.
meanings.sent2: The board renominates the CEO for another term after a successful year.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel renominates its favorite tree for the 'Tree of the Year' award.
meanings.sent4: The ocean renominates the lighthouse as the guardian of the coast.
meanings.sent5: The coach renominates the star player for the MVP award after a stellar performance.
